private_information: I can drive between places; driving duration = distance(from,to) / speed(truck0)
During driving I am not at any place (no over-all co-location)
truck0.goal: Help coordinate transport of crates so the environment goal is achieved.

private_information: I can drive between places; driving duration = distance(from,to) / speed(truck1)
During driving I am not at any place (no over-all co-location)
truck1.goal: Help coordinate transport of crates so the environment goal is achieved.

private_information: I can lift, put-down, load-to-truck, and unload-from-truck
Lifting duration = 1 for pick-up and put-down actions
I must remain at the place over all while performing actions
I can only manipulate crates at my current place
hoist0.goal: Help coordinate manipulation of crates so the environment goal is achieved.

private_information: I can lift, put-down, load-to-truck, and unload-from-truck
Lifting duration = 1 for pick-up and put-down actions
I must remain at the place over all while performing actions
I can only manipulate crates at my current place
hoist1.goal: Help coordinate manipulation of crates so the environment goal is achieved.

private_information: I can lift, put-down, load-to-truck, and unload-from-truck
Lifting duration = 1 for pick-up and put-down actions
I must remain at the place over all while performing actions
I can only manipulate crates at my current place
hoist2.goal: Help coordinate manipulation of crates so the environment goal is achieved.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the environment goal while minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks move between places and have speeds
Hoists must remain at the place for the duration of their actions
Trucks are mobile carriers; hoists manipulate crates

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
truck0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
truck1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
hoist0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
hoist1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
hoist2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
